✜ Making sense of water pouring problems
Date: Aug 19, 2013

There’s a class of puzzle problems known as water pouring problems. They are often posed as word problems involving your favorite cartoon character here, who is tasked to measure out a certain amount of liquid, usually his favorite drink, with scientific accuracy using a limited number of unmarked vessels of known capacities. Such problems are supposed to be hard and they are hard if done wrong even for a computer. I’ve seen some...

✜ Envar - A better way to manage evironment variables on windows
Date: May 15, 2013

What Is It?

A console application for managing Windows environment variables

Why Make This?

If you are a developer and you install lots of tools that you need to have on your PATH, you probably have faced name conflicts, general clutter or even ran out of space to keep all your paths. On Linux it’s not much of a problem since you can neatly keep all your variables in bash scripts. On Windows however there isn’t any easy way to persistently change them without ...
